doc.repnme: The Economic Returns of Sanitation Interventions in Indonesia
doc.abstracts: The Economics of Sanitation Initiative (ESI) is a multi-country study launched in 2007 as a response by the World Bank's Water and Sanitation Program to address major gaps in evidence among developing countries on the economic aspects of sanitation. Its objective is to provide economic evidence to increase the volume and efficiency of public and private spending on sanitation. This research brief summarizes the key findings of study second phase, cost-benefit analysis of alternative sanitation options, from Indonesia.
